questions.question_text: Which hypervisor requires a host OS to run and is not allowed to directly access the hosts hardware and resources?

choices.D: View the configuration of all GigabitEthernet interfaces
choices.C: Set the description of interface GigabitEthernet1 to "1"
choices.A: Discover the IP address of interface GigabitEthernet1
choices.B: Remove the IP address from interface GigabitEthernet1

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The NETCONF object is sent to a Cisco IOS XE switch. What is the purpose of the object?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct

comments.content: The <nc:get> operation with a subtree filter specifies that it wants to obtain information about the GigabitEthernet interface with the name 1 (the ip address of the interface).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
The XML snippet specifies a NETCONF RPC request that retrieves configuration information for GigabitEthernet interface 1. It does not request to remove the IP address, set a description, or view the configuration of all GigabitEthernet interfaces. Instead, it specifically targets GigabitEthernet1 and retrieves its configuration, which could include its IP address. Therefore, option A is the only truth

questions.question_text: Which protocol does Cisco SD-WAN use to protect control plane communication?
Which security option protects credentials from sniffer attacks in a basicAPI authentication?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
SSL/TLS encrypts transmitted data, which ensures that it can't be deciphered if it gets intercepted by an attacker, such as in sniffer attacks.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the descriptions of the VSS technology from the left to the right. Not all options are used.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Lets talk about the difference between both the technology

Switch Stacking uses proprietary cabling and is limited in distance while in the case of Cisco VSS, It uses 10 GE interfaces and so it can be geographically separated
In the case of stacking, no configuration required if switch supports stacking while in the case of Cisco VSS concept, you need to configure about the VSS and VSL on the switches.
You can have stack upto 9 switches via stack cabling, while in the Cisco VSS, only two switches can be the part of VSS.
For Cisco portfolio, Cisco switches like 2960 or 3750,3850 will be the part of the cisco stack switching while Cisco 4500 catalysts, Cisco 6500 and Cisco 6800 catalysts are using the concept of Cisco VSS.
Another thing like Cisco stack switching generally used at Access layer while Cisco VSS can be used at distribution or core layers.
given answers is correct
given answers is correct
VSS can be used on 2 devices and is both supported on 4500 and 6500 cat switches they can be in different locations

Reference:
https://community.cisco.com/t5/switching/vss-vs-stackwise-vs-vpc/td-p/2586871
